column4: I am doing a dist-upgrade to feisty (I probably did it from Dapper :s) and I get an error that dpkg return -1 for mysql-server. Any way I can skip mysql-server?
To dapper, eh?  That's a no no.
er, from dapper even.  I suppose english is a no no for me tonight.
no, I mean, from Dapper, to Feisty:)
could that be the problem?
right, still no good.  Shouldve gone through edgy.
too late now:s
you'll most likely have to get your hands dirty with fixing some stuff.  Does it tell you why mysql-server isn't instlaling?
no
but I want to skip it and do it later
or can I uninstall it?
then just remove the package
wont that remove the data from the database?
I can't permit it to loose that data
Uh, it shouldn't.  Just removing the package should keep the config/etc files, just removing the programs.  However, to be absolutely sure, you should back up.
just don't --purge
ok, thanks for your help. Just a little question... where can I find the data files?
to back it up
uh, no idea.  Heh.  You probably need to do some sort of dump via SQL/whtaever to have a usable backup anyway (export/import)
usually stuff like that doesn't work well if you just copy out the file.
that's true... mysqldump is the tool I need ;) thanks for your help
